noun.description: A member of any of several peoples inhabiting the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India.
A group of Indic languages spoken in the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India, of which the most important is Nepali.

adjective.description: Relating to the Pahari or their languages.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Thomas Bacon (1813–1892). From Hindi (and other local vernaculars) pahāṛī of or from the hills, native or inhabitant of the hills from pahāṛ mountain area + Hindi -ī, suffix forming adjectives and derived nouns.
